intro: Didiscus dusenii, commonly known as the Dusen's didiscus, is a rare flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of southern China. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, palmate leaves and showy, pale yellow to white flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils at high altitudes. It is known for its compact growth habit and is often found in humid, shaded environments. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
